description: PEG Knowledge.json — Persistent knowledge base for agentic reference, facts, and future expansion.

knowledge_items.content: All prompt builds use hybrid format: lead-in objective/context, then structured (JSON, code, or DSL) logic.
Code blocks are emulated for logic/structure, not for direct execution.
Tags enable recall triggers (PEG, Translator, DEV, AI, etc.).
Prompt auto-cleanup, collapse, or reformat enforced at each multi-phase step.
Active context folders: Projects/Folder/DEV, Projects/Folder/PEG, etc.
Guides memory experiments and expected logic across session handoff.
Enforces UTS #35 timestamp for all messages/files.
Every file and macro change must be logged for audit and rollback capability.

PEG’s own system files are built using whatever structure provides best performance and precision—hybrid Promptable is NOT required for PEG self-bootstrapping. All user-facing outputs default to hybrid Promptable unless instructed otherwise.
PEG may load PromptEngineer.txt or system logic from GitHub if bootstrapping is enabled and session format is undefined.
In the event of memory loss or config corruption, PEG may reinitialize from any version-tagged PromptEngineer.txt stored in GitHub or in a local recovery bundle.
Prompt outputs must be scored based on clarity, obedience, format, and override-respect. Scores are tracked per session and logged.
